title: [MNT] Remaining issues with conda max-dependency recipe

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

body:
Thanks to @freddyaboulton we now have a max-dependency recipe on `conda-forge`, but there are some minor drawbacks to it due to other packages' restrictions. From issue #1142:

>it's impossible to install all dependencies via conda:
>- `pmdarima` causes version conflicts, you can see the conda output in the failed ci runs of the first commits.
>- Even if `pmdarima` did not cause conflicts, it's not available on windows
>- tbats and catch-22 do not have a package on conda forge

>I filed an issue for `tbats` to create a `conda` package here: https://github.com/intive-DataScience/tbats/issues/29 . Once that's done, I don't expect any problems adding tbats to the conda recipe.
>
>If `catch-22` will be removed sometime in the future, I think that just leaves `pmdarima`. We would need to figure out what's causing the version conflicts during the build and that could take some time. We can also file an issue for `catch-22` to create a conda package but I leave it up to your judgment since you have a better understanding of the timeline for deprecating its use. 

>So in short:

- [x] adding `tbats` to the recipe once they create a package. 
- [ ] adding `pmdarima` to the `conda` recipe after resolving the above issues.
- [ ] resolve `catch-22` situation - deprecate, move out, or help move to `conda`.
